description.narrative: GGGI has been developing plans to work with the Least Developed Countries Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency Initiative (LDC-REEEI) in advancing the interests and building the capacity of the regional initiatives that utilizes local expertise rather than international consultants and replicate what works. GGGI interventions are rooted in supporting the Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency Initiative of a collaborative effort of partner organizations and the LDC Group to achieve universal access to clean energy for their people through integrated, sustainable and affordable modern energy approaches that scale up the share of renewables in the energy mix and maximize potential for energy savings. As part of the TL work plan 2018, GGGI supported the REEEI and ensured its sustainable energy activities aligned to the structure of the LDC Group 2017-2018 Work Plan (WP). Planned outputs directly addressed and supported LDC member countries on technical support, tracking delivery, enabling learning, fostering multi-stakeholder engagement, and strategic partnerships. The support promotes rapid transformational action to improve policies and to mobilize finance, and will explore effective action in: • Stimulating energy for productive sectors • Strengthening energy planning, to inform target setting and NDCs; • Tackling policy and regulatory barriers; and • Strengthen capacity of LDCs and Learning Exchanges for Regulators, Policy Makers, and Energy Planners.

To support GGGI LDC member countries to address the full range of their renewable energy and energy efficiency goals, and provide an opportunity to cement the strong partnership with key government stakeholders as well as to effectively share green growth best practices among the LDC member countries.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04579 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: GGGI technical reports, monographs, or policy briefs prepared on energy topics.

Insight brief, entitled “Africa leapfrog of off grid-energy in support of NDC implementation” drafted ? Technical report, titled “SDG 7 Progress Report: GGGILDC countries”, drafted and shared for publication committee review and approva

Blogpost (Posted) on IPS (Inter Press Service): Entitled “Aborted Fuel Tax Initiative in France: Its Ramifications for Green Growth”. ? Resource mobilization: New contracts with China for Asia (our first with EU, in China ~100 Euro) secured.
Delivery of Integrated capacity development (ICD) program at the regional hubs

description.narrative: In 2018, GGGI delivered an integrated Capacity development program, which included: Regional capacity development workshop on “Financing NDC Implementation in the Energy Sector” in collaboration IRENA, GCF and LUCCC, delivered in June 26-28, 2018 in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso. ? More than 25 participants from 5 countries (Senegal, Burkina Faso, Guinea, the Gambia and Ivory Coast) attained the workshop. In-country capacity development workshop in Vientiane, Lao PDR during the consultation workshop to enhance readiness in implementing National Determined Contributions (NDC), November 13-14, 2018. ? Invited a total of 40 government officials to participate in the Technical Working Groups of NDC and MRV and attend the two-day workshop. Regional capacity development on NDC implementation in Energy Sector in collaboration with ECREEE, Korean embassy in Senegal UNECA (IDEP) held in November 20-23, 2018 in Dakar, Senegal. ? The capacity development workshop enhanced the capacity in developing NDC targets and planning NDC implementation in Senegal and highlight approaches adopted in west African countries to raise the ambition of climate action through NDC in the renewable energy sector. ? Participants included representatives from government institutions, academia, financiers, researchers, architects, private sector, development support agencies, civil society organizations, municipalities/local governments, and other experts.

title.narrative: Increased capacity of stakeholders on Green Growth (3 capacity building events delivered)
Development of Green Growth training Modules

description.narrative: In 2018, GGGI developed and finalized 1 capacity building module entitled “Financing NDC Implementation in the Energy Sector: This Module was used and tested during the NDC workshops as follows: ? In a regional capacity development workshop on June 26- 28 in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso; ? In a capacity development workshop in Vientiane, Lao PDR - Nov 13?14, 2018; ? In a capacity development workshop session during the Senegal GGGWeek2018 in November 28-29, 2018 in Dakar, Senegal, in collaboration with Korean Embassy, ECOWAS Center for Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency (ECREEE); the UNECA/ IPED Regional Office; IRENA; and LUCCC; and ? In a webinar during the international energy workshop hosted by hosted by the Chalmers University of Technology, Gothenburg, Sweden on June 19-21, 2018.

title.narrative: ? 1 Capacity building module entitled “Financing NDC Implementation in the Energy Sector” finalized ? 2 Regional capacity development workshops on “Financing NDC Implementation in the Energy Sector” delivered (Burkina Faso & Senegal) ? 1 In-Country Capacity development workshop delivered (Lao PDR) ? At least 70% of participants gain improved knowledge/skills from attending GGGI capacity building programs.

Develop the consortium of Universities and research institutions from Senegal as hub to build the Network in the region for long-term capacity-building, education and research on climate change development.

description.narrative: In 2018, GGGI supported member countries in formally launching the LUCCC initiatives. The consortium of Universities and research institutions to build the Network for long-term capacity-building, education, and research on climate change development. The Network serves as a repository of knowledge and capacity to tackle climate change through sustainable and long-term capacity-building efforts to promote education and research. Launch of GGGI-LUCCC partnership on long-term capacity building in Senegal and Ethiopia. ? Universities and research center representatives demonstrated their commitments to contribute to the LUCCC implementation and talked about similar initiatives, gaps, and threats before making recommendations for the effective implementation of LUCCC. ? The capacity development workshop to catalyze cooperation among universities convened representatives from various universities and research institutes in Senegal and Ethiopia. Participated to the bellagio, italy for the planning meeting of the luccc partners (24th - 28th september 2018). ? Drafted and contributed for the LUCCC planning meeting in strategic plan as the modality for the future endeavors of the consortium as a wider south-south capacity-building network, as well assign each member to commit to undertake climate actions for their respective country specific thematic area. ? Discussed and developed a log-framework as a roadmap to achieve the outcomes and goals of the LUCCC in immediate (2020), medium-term (2025) and long-term (2030) time dimension relying on five-year rolling workplan; and ? Initiated the preliminary tasks to draft an abstract for the perspective column of nature and climate change focusing on the ‘history of LDCs in global climate negotiations and the status-quo of capacity-building efforts in these countries in a post-Paris agreement world’.

title.narrative: ? LUCCC initiative formally launched in Senegal and Ethiopia ? LUCCC serves as a platform for long-term capacity building and knowledge repository on climate change for development.
